title: Riot support.
body:
I hate to target anyone, but dear god the way you guys handle shit is pathetic.

I just had to do a run around to prove my connection isn't an issue and provide logs to that fact, and then i realize when i check my support ticket just now, that they are just running me through a useless damn loop of horse shit over my connection.

I then half ass a solution in about 15 minutes by opting out of the beta client which was causing the issue.

Worst part is, Riot support could have easily helped me by actually reading the request at all, but instead ran me down a useless bunch of chores that would have sent me in circles for the next few weeks if i bothered following them.

So riot support listen to this please.

**READ FUCKING SUPPORT TICKETS BEFORE YOU RESPOND, AND READ ALL OF IT.**

replies.body: JasonWazza complaing about riot. Must be a day ending in y

That sounds pretty frustrating - I have Telstra at home so I can totally empathise with the feeling of being sent around a circle #savage. Can you share the support ticket number so we can review what happened?

25342793, which is referencing the issue i had in 24672001.

But at this point i've just told the support what i need him to give me instead of me having to get through these stupid hoops.
I wouldn't recommend treating Riot support the way most people treat their support :P

Well he did finally end up helping (Just) but for fucks sake he is incompetent.

When someone submits a support ticket, read it.

This is rule 1, riot support doesn't follow this rule.

Rule 2 should be stop Ctrl+Cing and Ctrl+Ving the whole fucking document when the user needs one line and gives you exact fucking details on what he needs (what i did, i got back a wall of text that while it held the answer, almost got skipped entirely because the majority of it didn't apply to me.)

Rule 3: work out the issue first, then try and fix it, don't first try and fix an issue that isn't had (what originally started with this ticket was the support trying to get me to "fix my connection" which had nothing to do with the issue, because lol 40-60 ping)

I can definitely respect how this could be frustrating, but as a person who as worked in IT, I can vouch for how difficult it can be to work with hundreds and hundreds of people that just get snarky and rude at the drop of a hat.

Not saying that you were doing those things, but likely the person who was working with you may have just come from back to back assholes and was just trying to do their job.

Hey man,

Let me preface that I'm not a support tech but I looked through the ticket today.

While I think your frustrations are valid (our stuff should just work!), I have to note that the support staff were genuinely trying to figure out the root cause of your issue. You might not think that it was/is your connection but when trying to diagnose a problem, sometimes its best to rule-out the most obvious reasons. Yes it's tedious and tiresome especially when you want to just crush some peeps in-game but sometimes that's just what you need - if you want to fix something properly.

Having 40-60ms ping does not mean there's no issue with your connection. Maybe there's something blocking the connection to the patching server which then bugs out the client (again, not a tech here just thinking outloud). 

Regardless, I guess you wanted a band-aid fix - which i 100% would too - but support wanted to try and figure out the underlying problem so you don't run into it again later.

Hoping the issue doesnt come back tho! GL :)

>Regardless, I guess you wanted a band-aid fix

Just going to cover this.

It wasn't a Band-aid fix, because i now know exactly what it was.

Likelihood is i stopped in the middle of a patch on the beta client, and that caused the beta client exe file to become corrupted, which is why whenever i trying to opt-in to the beta client, i ran into the issue of having the client, but being unable to fix it because it required the beta client to patch.

This was the fix i needed, because put simply i had to delete that and have it re-downloaded.

It is 100% fixed now and i have ran the beta client to make 100% sure.

The issue shouldn't come back as long as i don't close the Beta client mid patch (which is likely what caused the issue.)

That said, this shows an issue on the Riot side in that, the client SHOULDN'T be corruptible to the point where it is in-operable, to even get a patch.

Welcome to Telecom Tech Support.

Especially if you live in buttfuck nowhere and literally the only option is Telstra because no one else wants to rent the lines from Telstra in your area.
It's funny though, because riot is trying to give me telecom support for a league client issue that i've had to fix myself, and had to tell them what they need to give me to fix it.

ctrl+c robotic response

+

Ctrl+v
 
= 

issue solved

Most likely the support person used a pre defined response from the ticketing system they use and was too lazy to delete the useless information.

Whatever happened to the days where customer service/support was trained to personalize every ticket in some way.

I'm certain he was using pre made responses, because there was 3 massive walls of text that really gave no help whatsoever.

Be great if their support was actually trained in reading and analyzing tickets, and then responding, maybe then they would have less issues with tickets because they won't end up being massively long amounts of response because of the copy paste machine.

Hell i thought the actual Riot support page search was supposed to be the part that gives automated responses based on the possible issues, not the support team itself.
